data.name: hakkimizda
data.value:
Project Name: Student Dormitory Automation Project Owner: Sercan KURBAN Technologies Used: C#, SQL, ADO.NET ************PROJECT DESCRIPTION************
Username: sercan Password: 1
There is only a single user login in our project. Before user login, 8 different language options appear: Turkish, English, German, Spanish, French, Italian, Russian and Japanese. After choosing one of these languages, we enter the username, password and security codes. If we enter incorrectly or leave the fields blank, a warning screen will appear. After logging into our project, we see 8 different fields. The admin panel shows the current student's name, surname and room. The first row is the Students panel. In this panel, student registration, deletion, update, search and listing operations are performed. There are rooms available for the student to choose during the student registration process. The student can choose any room, starting from 100 for 1 person, and rooms starting with 200 for 2 people. When a room number starting with 100 (for example: 101) is selected, the next student will not be able to choose that room. Likewise, after the student is deleted, that room will be active again.
In the personnel panel, addition, deletion and update operations are available, just like students.
Adding, deleting and updating operations are available in the Sections panel, as in other panels.
In the payments section, if the student is registered, the student's initial debt appears to be 3000 ₺. Here the administrator can process the payment of the student's debt.
In the expenses section, it is possible to add, update and list payments such as electricity, water and natural gas.
In the statistics panel, the student can view the total cash based on the debt paid or view the price according to the months he/she selects.
In the Administrator Settings panel, users can change password, change language, add notes, receive reports and log out.
In the Ease of Access panel, you can directly open Calculator and Paint programs, read newspapers, listen to radio and music.
